result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R. Straight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael R. Straight is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael R. Straight was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).
  • Michael R. Straight was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
JOC AMENDED:  130 days sentence credit, per Stipulation and Order filed June 26, 2015
Concurrent with: current sentence

Conditions:

Absolute sobriety.

No assaultive or aggressive behavior.

Attend, pay for and successfully complete any treatment and/or programming recommended by the agent.

Maintain employment (some type of income).

No contact with Tricia Straight without prior agent approval.

Submit to random UA's. 

Court orders one set of costs.  Costs to be paid as a condition of supervision.

Sentence credit yet-to-be determined.  Court orders it determined within 30 days.
Concurrent with: current sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 2 and any other sentence

records.addlTxt: Copy of Memorandum Decision on Jail Credit - Insufficient Address, Unable to Forward (missing inmate #) - Attempting to resend
Memorandum Decision on Jail Credit (cc by clerk to Def, DA, Atty. McDougal, and RCSD)
from ADA, regarding credit

ADDRESS INFO for Michael R. Straight
Current: Fox Lake Correctional Facility, PO Box 200, Fox Lake, WI 53933 United States  (Effective: 05-17-2016)
Prior: 28953 N. Adams Street, Lone Rock, WI 53556
Letter from Judge Sharp - Attempted Not Known, Unable to Forward - Found current address on another case, Resending to: Fox Lake Correctional
Response from Judge Sharp
State's Response to Defense Request for Credit.

Motion for Sentence Credit (by MS - cc by clerk to DA and Atty. McDougal who last represented def)

(Court has given the DA's office until April 20th to respond.  If no response, sentence credit will be granted.)
Sentencing Hearing Held this 12th Day of June, 2015.
for 130 days sentence credit - JOC to be amended

Defendant Michael R. Straight in custody with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Argument by ADA Forehand & Atty McDougal. DA recommends: Ct 2-7 yrs init confinement, 5 years ext sup consecutive to current sentence, Ct 3-1 year.  Atty M. recommends 2 years init confinement consecutive to current sentence. 

Sentencing:     Ct 2: 4 yrs init confinement, 5 yrs ext. sup, concurrent to current sentence. Condittions of ext. sup. absolute sobriety, no assaultive, aggressive beh, attend, pay for and successfully complete any treatment & programming rec. by agent, maintain employment (some type of income), no contact with TS without prior agent approval. Random UA's. One set of costs as condition of supervision. 
                         Ct 3: 1 yrs init confinement, 1 year ext. sup. concurrent with count 2 and any other sentence.

Credit to be determined within 30 days.
ADDENDUM to original PSI (cc to DA and Atty. McDougal)

phone call from TS - wants to know why the PSI was filed on May 6th, two days before Agent S talked with her; clerk has returned the call with a message to TS, indicating that the PSI was filed electronically through the DOC/CCAP interface on May 6th - if TS has questions about why it was filed then, she needs to contact the agent or the def's attorney
Sentencing hearing at 06-12-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Michael R. Straight in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M states Defense is not ready to proceed due to recent development - both victim and def are objecting to proceeding today; states victim has reviewed DOC manual in re to PSI format and believes PSI is not complete; victim wants PSI writer to revisit topics that victim feels are important.  Victim addresses the Court.  ADA addresses the Court - does not object to postponing the sentencing, not for reasons related to the PSI concerns which she feels would not have made a difference, but rather so that the def has more time to confer with his attorney.  Friday, June 12th at 9 for sentencing.  Court directs PSI writer to revisit the "DOC Community Corrections Policy and Procedures Manual" with focus on the section in investigations re writing PSI's and to re-address the issues re the marital relationship and the current living situation.  ADA notes that doc was dates Dec. 2002; not sure if there's an updated doc that hasn't been published online.  Court directs PSI writer to re-issue a report (and send to all parties) by June 1st.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing at 04-23-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Michael R. Straight in custody and in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA recites plea agreement, requests argued sentencing. Information has been filed. Colloquy re. plea questionnaire/waiver of rights. Def pleads NC to count 2 & 3.  Cts 1 & 4 are dismissed. Further colloquy. Court finds factual basis, accepts pleas of NC, finds def guilty. Court will order PSI to be completed by 04/15. DOC is to provide copies to DA and defense counsel. DA addresses the Court for victim. Court will permit contact between the parties. Court lifts 940.47 order, bond is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference at 02-13-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Michael R. Straight in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A. McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  State has filed the information with the same charges as the complaint.  Def stands mute for entry of NG pleas.  Atty. M requests status for possible resolution.  Court sets Feb. 13 at 11.

Case victim addresses the Court - asks to be able to see the Def.  Court denies request to modify bond.  Status conference scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment at 01-28-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Michael R. Straight in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A. McDougal in court for Defendant Michael R. Straight.  Prelim waived.  Colloquy re waiver.  Victim addresses Court; requests deletion of no contact.  Court denies request to modify bond.  Matter adj. to Jan. 28 for arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing at 01-07-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Michael R. Straight in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A. McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M states that the parties are working towards resolution but don't have it resolved yet; asks for Jan. 7th - prelim.  ADA Forehand states victim, present in court, wants to be able to have phone contact with def.  Presently, that's one of the prohibitions of def's bond.  ADA Forehand states she objects to the victim's request.  Victim addresses the Court.  Court denies request to modify bond.  Bond remains as previously set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
from victim to Judge Sharp - request re no contact
Status conference at 12-15-2014 02:00 pm

Attorney Lisa A. McDougal in court for Defendant Michael R. Straight. Prosecuting Atty Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael R. Straight appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail where he is in custody.  Atty. M waives formal reading of the complaint; also waives time limits for prelim; asks for status.  Court states charges and informs def of possible max. penalties.  Colloquy re prelim time limits.  Status requested and set for Monday, 12/15 at 2 when Atty. M is here on other matters.

Court notes letter from victim asking for change in no contact prohibition to allow for contact while def is in the jail.  Atty. Forehand objects to modification of bail conditions.  Atty. M and victim address the Court.  Court states concerns re alleged violations of the Court's order.  Request denied.  Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 12-03-2014 11:00 am

Attorney Lisa A. McDougal appeared by phone means for Defendant Michael R. Straight. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael R. Straight appeared by video means, in custody at Richland County Jail.  Court states charges and asks Atty. M how she wants to proceed with scheduling.  Atty. M asks that this be adj. to tomorrow at 11.  Atty. Forehand makes request on behalf of the victim for return of property.  Atty. M states she thought victim was going to ask for modification of bond "no contact" prohibitions.  Atty. Forehand states that victim is not making a modification request at this time; DA opposes any such request at this time.  Def has no objection to returning the requested property.  RCSD to assist with that exchange.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 11:00 am.
written minutes
